Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_hire.model.manager

Class WolfHire

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_hire.model.manager.WolfHire
public class WolfHire extends Object
The WolfHire class controls the creation and modification of many positions including adding a position, loading positions, saving positions, getting applications. The class interacts with the other classes of application and posiition to create the hiring system through which applications move.
Author:
Lalitha Edupuganti

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static WolfHire getInstance()
      getInstance will check if the singleton is null. If the singleton is null, then getInstance() calls the private WolfHire() constructor to create the single instance.
      Returns:
      singleton the singleton used in creating the instance

    • addNewPosition

      public void addNewPosition(String positionName, int hoursPerWeek, int payRate)
      Creates a new Position with the given info and adds it to the end of the positions list. The position is then loaded as the activePosition by calling the loadPosition(String positionName) method.
      Parameters:
      positionName - the positionName of the new position
      hoursPerWeek - the hours per week of the new position
      payRate - the pay rate of the new position
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the positionName parameter is null, empty string, or a duplicate of an existing position name (case-insensitive)

    • loadPosition

      public void loadPosition(String positionName)
      Find the Position with the given name in the list, makes it active or activePosition, and sets the application id for that position so that any new Applications added to the position are created with the next correct id.
      Parameters:
      positionName - the positionName of the position to be made active
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if there is no position with the given name.

    • getActivePosition

      public Position getActivePosition()
      Returns the activePosition or null if the is no activePosition.
      Returns:
      the ActivePosition

    • getActivePositionName

      public String getActivePositionName()
      Returns the active position name
      Returns:
      the name of the active position

    • getPositionList

      public String[] getPositionList()
      Returns a String array of position names in the order they are listed in the positions list.
      Returns:
      the string array of position names

    • loadPositionsFromFile

      public void loadPositionsFromFile(String fileName)
      Uses the PositionReader to read the given fileName. The returned list of Positions are added to the positions field. The first position in the list returned from PositionReader is made the activePosition
      Parameters:
      fileName - the file to read from

    • savePositionsToFile

      public void savePositionsToFile(String fileName)
      Write the list of Positions to the file using the PositionWriter class.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the file to write to
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the activePosition is null

    • getApplicationsAsArray

      public String[][] getApplicationsAsArray(String filter)
      method returns a 2D Object array that is used to populate the ApplicationTableModel with information about the applications
      Parameters:
      filter - provides a string to filter on
      Returns:
      2d object array with applications

    • getApplicationById

      public Application getApplicationById(int id)
      Returns the given application or null if there is no application with the given id in the activePosition.
      Parameters:
      id - that is used to get an application with the specific id
      Returns:
      the given applicaton or null if no application with given id

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand(int id, Command c)
      Method used to execute the command provided by parameter c on specific application provided by id
      Parameters:

      c - command to be executed
